title: 109_hr5413
content: The Act aims to improve the codification of title 46, United States Code, by incorporating public comments and amendments made after the cutoff date specified in a previous bill. It specifically addresses personal injury to or death of seamen. The Act aims to improve the codification of title 46, United States Code by addressing personal injury or death of seamen through amendments to Section 30104 and Chapter 537. It allows seamen or their representatives to bring actions under US laws for recovery, with the option of admiralty or trial by jury. Venue for legal actions is determined by the employer's location. The Act amends Section 53701 of title 46, United States Code by redesignating paragraphs and defining terms like Administrator and Secretary. It also amends Section 53706(c) to prioritize certain vessels in guaranteeing obligations. The Administrator shall prioritize vessels eligible for guarantees, giving priority to vessels constructed with assistance under the Maritime Security Act of 2003 and vessels suitable for naval auxiliary service in times of war or national emergency as determined by the Secretary of Defense. The Secretary of Defense must determine if a vessel meets certain criteria within 30 days of a request from the Administrator. Title 46, United States Code, is amended to include the Administrator in various subsections and to make adjustments to waiver requirements. Section 53708 of title 46, United States Code, is amended to include the Administrator in various subsections and make adjustments to waiver requirements. Section 53712(b) of title 46, United States Code, is amended to allow for third-party independent analysis of risk factors by a private sector expert selected by the Secretary or Administrator. Section 53712(b) of title 46, United States Code, is amended to include requirements for additional payments, collateral, or equity contributions in the loan agreement if a requirement has been waived under section 53707(d). Subsections (c) and (d) of section 53717 are amended to remove references to "of Commerce." Section 53732(e)(2) is amended to include "of Defense" after "Secretary." (8) Title 46, United States Code, is amended to replace "Secretary" and "Secretary of Transportation" with "Administrator" in various sections. Section 53710(b)(1) is also amended to replace "Secretary's" with "Administrator's". (9) Section 53732 is amended to include "of Defense" after "Secretary". Title 46, United States Code, is amended to replace "Secretary" with "Administrator" in various sections, including sections 53722 and 53723. Additionally, sections 53715(d)(1), 53716(d)(3), 53721(c), 53722(a)(1), 53724(b) are amended to include "or Administrator's" after "Secretary's". SEC. 4. MISCELLANEOUS AMENDMENTS. Title 46, United States Code, is amended by changing "Naval Reserve" to "Navy Reserve" in chapters 513 and 515. Section 51504(f) is amended to specify that the Secretary will pay State maritime academies for fuel costs of vessels used for training, with maximum amounts set for each fiscal year. Section 51505(b)(2)(B) is also amended. Section 51701(a) is amended to include functions to assist the United States merchant marine as determined necessary by the Secretary. Section 51907 is amended to allow the Secretary of Transportation to provide decorations, medals, and replacements as authorized by the chapter. The Secretary of Transportation is authorized to provide decorations, medals, and replacements as needed for the United States merchant marine. The Secretary of Transportation is authorized to provide decorations, medals, and replacements for the United States merchant marine under the new chapter 541 - Miscellaneous, which includes assistance for small shipyards and maritime communities. The Secretary of Transportation can provide decorations, medals, and replacements for the US merchant marine under chapter 541 - Miscellaneous. Section 55101(b) is amended by inserting "or" after paragraph (2), striking paragraph (3), and redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (3). Section 60301 is amended to adjust tonnage fees for fiscal years 2006 through 2010 and thereafter. The tonnage fees are adjusted for fiscal years 2006 through 2010 and beyond, with a rate of 13.5 cents per ton up to 67.5 cents per ton annually for the specified period, and 6 cents per ton up to 30 cents per ton annually thereafter. SEC. 5. REPEALS. The following provisions are repealed, except for rights, duties, penalties, or proceedings before the enactment of this Act. The Statutes at Large list various public laws and sections, including those from 1936 and 2006. In 2006, public laws and sections were listed in the Statutes at Large, including provisions related to 515(g)(2), 3502, 3507, 3509, and 3510. Additionally, in February, a law related to 4001 was enacted. The Act will only take effect if H.R. 1442 in the 109th Congress is passed, becoming effective immediately upon enactment of the bill.
